title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 December 2013 - XWiki
content:

09:08 <Denis> has quit  
09:21 <Kaisen> What will be the best way to create from an live xwiki a seperated test enviroment? Export the database and with the export function the content and after import everything in a vanilla xwiki?  
09:24 <vmassol> Kaisen: yes copy the DB, the expanded WAR and the data dir. See http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Backup  
09:24 <Kaisen> Thanks  
09:25 <Kaisen> Just want to be sure I did the right :)  
09:25 <vmassol> k  
09:49 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:45 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <lucaa> has quit  
10:48 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <DarkKnightCZ> how exactly does job logging works? tmortagne told me yesterday i have to set request id to invoke job logging, but all i get is serialized job instance (and nothing logged by logger)  
10:54 <vmassol> no idea sorry  
10:56 <DarkKnightCZ> no problem :) i guess i'll just wait for tmortagne... but i've noticed weird logging behaviour before (old plugin logging shows in stdout only when setting stdout to trace, even if it's error), but since i try it on 5.1, it could be fixed in 5.2/5.3  
11:02 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: you'll have to wait a bit… he's back on the 30th of Dec  
11:02 <vmassol> (holidays)  
11:02 <DarkKnightCZ> hehe, ok then :) i will use system.out for testing purposes :)  
11:11 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: by the way, you could help me with "design problem", i've created component that acts as API for videolibrary (takes uploaded attachments, converts them to playable format and adds them to different document), that works without problem (now), but it uses libav for converting (which means it uses runtime to execute converter on OS) and there is this problem, because every server can has specific settings (ie how many cores to use etc.), they sho  
11:13 <DarkKnightCZ> so which is better, create wrapper and let admins to change values or have specified configuration fixed inside component (and only server admins should have the possibility to change it)?  
11:15 <vmassol> sorry DarkKnightCZ not much time now, going into meeting real soon and I need to prepare. then severla other meetings in the afternoon, busy day for me… ;)  
11:16 <DarkKnightCZ> it's okay :)  
11:22 <vmassol> has quit  
11:27 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:12 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
12:13 <vmassol> has quit  
12:34 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
13:52 <Kaisen> Hello, I'm struggling with links with anchor setting. If I have a Headline which have "space" between the names I didn't get the anchor to work. For example I want to link to the headline "1.2.3 Sub Headline" I would use the link [[Subheadline Label>>doc:Space.PageName||anchor="H1\.2\.3 Sub Headline"]]  
14:26 <GuillaumeF> What syntax are you using, 2.1?  
14:30 <maxr\_> has quit  
14:32 <vmassol1> GuillaumeF: no that's not correct  
14:32 <vmassol1> that's 2.0  
14:33 <vmassol1> for 2.1 it's: ||anchor="HSubHeadline"  
14:33 <vmassol1> Kaisen: regarding the anchor you can check the genertaed html  
14:34 <vmassol1> (view source in your browser)  
14:34 <vmassol1> (we remove all spaces and special chars)  
14:35 <vmassol1> Denis: hi  
14:35 <vmassol1> Denis: when you have some time maybe you could have a look at XWIKI-9826 to verify if it's not a regression that arose with the new rights module  
14:36 <vmassol1> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9826  
14:36 <vmassol1> bad bot!  
14:36 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
14:38 <lucaa> has quit  
14:43 <Kaisen> Witch ||anchor="HSubHeadline I didn't get it working but with #HSubHeadline  
14:47 <lucaa1> has quit  
14:48 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:48 <Kaisen> Forget it, it is related to the wiki syntax. As usal the problem site in front of the wiki :)  
14:53 <lucaa> has quit  
15:06 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:07 <Kaisen> has quit  
16:29 <j-simard> I'm having hard time to create a subwiki into a Velocity script which is executed by a default login user  
16:29 <j-simard> I don't want he have rights to create it  
16:30 <j-simard> The script is an Admin script  
16:30 <j-simard> I use the $services.wiki.createWiki  
16:30 <j-simard> (new in 5.3 I believe)  
16:31 <j-simard> And I don't really understand how to bypass the public API in Velocity or Groovy in order to reproduce the effects of this function (without rights checking)  
16:31 <j-simard> Indeed, I don't know how to get the WikiManager instance  
16:33 <j-simard> I tried some solutions that have been proposed to me  
16:34 <j-simard> 1) In Groovy, import com.xpn.xwiki.web.Utils;  
16:34 <j-simard> then Utils.getComponentManager(WikiManager.class);  
16:34 <j-simard> 2) Utils.getComponentManager(WikiManager.class);  
16:35 <j-simard> 3) Use the wikimanager plugin (which I believed is deprecated?) with $xwiki.wikimanager  
16:35 <j-simard> None of these solutions works for me  
16:37 <j-simard> Oops, the 2) was: $services.component.getInstance(DefaultWikiManager.class)  
16:38 <j-simard> bad copy/paste from the 1) [but still doesn't work]  
16:48 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
17:01 <j-simard> So, it seems that holidays will be welcomed because, WikiManager is accessible with $services.wiki  
17:01 <j-simard> The name has been changed in the 5.3  
17:41 <j-simard> has quit  
17:43 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki
